businessSummary.oneLiner: Government and enterprise AI data analytics platform ‚Äî transforming from core US defense/intelligence partner to commercial AI powerhouse
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since launching AIP (AI Platform), its commercial segment has exploded. Q4 2025 revenue hit $1.407B (+70% YoY), with US commercial revenue at $507M (+137% YoY). 2026 revenue guidance targets +61% growth, putting it on track for $10B. Recent highlights include a DHS $1B 5-year BPA, Rackspace AI infrastructure partnership expansion, and Mizuho upgrading to Outperform. However, the stock is in correction territory at 35% below its 52-week high of $207.
howTheyMakeMoney: US Government: DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS data analytics platform ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
US Commercial: Enterprise AI and data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), fastest growing segment
International Government: NATO allies and other foreign government contracts
International Commercial: Global enterprise clients (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers average $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration platform, core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Government/defense data analysis and decision-making platform
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN ‚Äî US Army next-generation intelligence system (major contract)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Very high valuation. Reflects +70% revenue growth and historically best software margins

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Still 100x+ on forward earnings. Maximum AI premium pricing

keyMetrics.name: Market Cap
keyMetrics.interpretation: $323B valuation for a $4.5B revenue company. Growth expectations are overwhelming

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 10th consecutive quarter of accelerating growth. 2026 guidance +61%

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Best in software industry history. Reflects AIP's high-value proposition

keyMetrics.name: ROE
keyMetrics.interpretation: Healthy capital efficiency. ROIC at 271.81% is exceptionally high

keyMetrics.name: PEG Ratio
keyMetrics.interpretation: Overvalued relative to growth territory. Valuation burden is clear

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA ‚Äî No-Bid Procurement Enabled
growthDrivers.description: DHS $1B 5-year BPA confirmed (2/19). CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA and all DHS agencies can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B (+$1.6B).

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace Partnership ‚Äî 30‚Üí250+ Dedicated Engineers, UK Sovereign DC
growthDrivers.description: Strategic AI deployment partnership with Rackspace announced (2/18). Running Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated engineers scaling from 30 to 250+ within 12 months.

growthDrivers.title: US Commercial Revenue +137% ‚Äî AIP-Driven Explosive Growth
growthDrivers.description: Q4 US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). Top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY). US commercial deal value backlog $4.38B (+145% YoY).

growthDrivers.title: Mizuho Upgrade to Outperform + Citi $260 Target
growthDrivers.description: Mizuho upgraded Hold‚ÜíBuy with $195 target (2/18). Citi maintains $260 Strong Buy. Wall Street coverage expansion accelerating.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Unrivaled #1 in government/defense AI, rapidly building commercial AI position through AIP. Irreplaceable in data security + AI integration.

moats.description: Highest-level security clearances with CIA, NSA, DHS. DHS BPA enables no-bid procurement. DISA IL5/IL6 on-premises/edge authorization. Competitors need years to achieve equivalent clearances.
More customers improve AI models, better models attract more customers ‚Äî a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. Airbus multi-year contract renewal and DHS 5-year BPA demonstrate stickiness.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Expanding AI capabilities on data cloud platform but weak in government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private company, data lakehouse. Competing in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly behind in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by former key Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction denied, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: Barchart: 'PLTR Down 38% from 52-Week High, Buy Opportunity?'
recentNews.significance: Fundamental reassessment during correction. Business momentum solid despite valuation concerns.

recentNews.headline: DHS $1B 5-Year BPA Confirmed ‚Äî No-Bid Procurement Enabled
recentNews.significance: RPO surged to $4.2B. All DHS agencies can directly procure Palantir software. Government revenue stability massively strengthened.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace AI Deployment Partnership ‚Äî 30‚Üí250+ Dedicated Engineers
recentNews.significance: Running Foundry/AIP on UK Sovereign data center. Key channel for international commercial expansion.

recentNews.headline: Mizuho Upgrades Hold‚ÜíBuy, Target $195
recentNews.significance: Growing analyst recognition of AIP's explosive commercial growth. Wall Street coverage expanding.

recentNews.headline: Q4 2025 Earnings ‚Äî Revenue $1.407B (+70%), Operating Margin 57%
recentNews.significance: 10th consecutive quarter of revenue acceleration. 2026 guidance +61%. Post-earnings surge on historically best software margins.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Citi Tyler Radke maintains $260 Strong Buy. Mizuho upgraded Hold‚ÜíBuy $195 (2/18). 9 of 20 Buy/Strong Buy, 10 Hold. Valuation debate is central.

risks.title: P/E 214x, PEG 2.18 ‚Äî Extreme Valuation
risks.description: $323B market cap for a $4.5B revenue company. Even at 70% growth, PEG 2.18 is overvalued territory. Sharp valuation correction inevitable if growth decelerates.

risks.title: 35% Below 52-Week High of $207 ‚Äî Software Sector Selloff
risks.description: Down 24%+ in 2026. Broader software sector valuation compression and risk-off sentiment.

risks.title: Stock-Based Compensation (SBC) Dilution
risks.description: Shares outstanding up +4.67% YoY. SBC dilutes EPS growth and potentially distorts GAAP profitability.

risks.title: Government Budget Cut Risk
risks.description: DOGE government efficiency push could mean defense/intelligence budget cuts. Government still 50%+ of revenue.

risks.title: Percepta AI Competitive Entry
risks.description: Former key Palantir employees founded Percepta AI. Non-compete injunction denied, now free to compete directly.

buyReasons.title: US Commercial Revenue +137% ‚Äî Core AI Platform Beneficiary
buyReasons.rationale: AIP-driven explosive commercial growth. Deal value backlog $4.38B (+145% YoY). On track for $10B revenue.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + DISA IL5/IL6 ‚Äî Government Revenue Lock-in
buyReasons.rationale: No-bid procurement across all DHS agencies. RPO $4.2B provides multi-year revenue visibility.

buyReasons.title: 57% Operating Margin ‚Äî Best in Software History
buyReasons.rationale: High-margin SaaS model. Additional margin expansion potential with scale.

buyReasons.title: 35% Discount from 52-Week High ‚Äî Dip Buying Opportunity
buyReasons.rationale: Fundamentals unchanged but sector selloff drove decline. Consensus target $188 (+39%) is attractive.

overallOpinion: Palantir is delivering the most impressive growth story in AI software. Q4 revenue +70%, US commercial +137%, and 57% operating margin is an unprecedented combination in software history.

However, a P/E of 214x and PEG of 2.18 means much is already priced in. Down 35% from 52-week highs but absolute valuation remains stretched. Trading below the 50-day SMA ($163) but above the 200-day SMA ($129), searching for direction.

Consensus target $188 (+39%) with Citi at $260. DHS $1B BPA and Rackspace partnership support growth sustainability. For investors betting on long-term AI growth, the correction zone presents a potential buying opportunity.
